title: If you're the guy who votes "no" on a remake
body:
I sincerely hope you step on a lego.

I hope your entire floor becomes a lego minefield deathtrap, and your only option to move around your house is to continuously step on legos for the rest of your life.

I wish that pain upon you.  I also hope that if you eventually do reach your door, with bloody lego-ruined feet, that the door mercilessly static shocks you and it really, really stings for a second or two.

And then when you get outside its just way to bright and you have trouble opening your eyes for a few seconds.

And then you get in your car to go wherever you're going, and your absolute least favorite song is on the radio and the dial has stopped working - at MAXIMUM volume.

Oh, and just remember... when you get home later that evening...

The legos are still there.

Reported for negative attitude kid! 1!1!
I'm currently silver.  Being a high tier smurf goes without saying.  Everyone is a high tier smurf in silver.  Just ask them, they'll tell you.
The one issue is legos aren't that bad in large quantities, or if you're expecting it. The main part of the pain in my opinion is just the surprise.

Implying that there are people out there who purposely walk on legos?

At least fire walkers have some tribal significance and entertainment value.  Purposely stepping on legos is just simply a sign of mental illness.

I honestly never understood why people who are clearly going to win in a normal, unranked, match don't surrender. It's not like you have anything to lose by doing it, and shouldn't you want a game which is challenging and maybe actually lets you improve rather than a 1 sided stomp fest which teaches you nothing?
This post is not about surrendering.  At all.
If you're the guy who starts a remake after being told the person who is afk is having a connection issue and will be back soon, I sincerely hope you step on a lego.

I mean, I don't care if your buddy has connection problems.  Him being afk is putting me and my team at a disadvantage, and if I can get out of that for free, I'm gonna try.  Don't really give a good god damn what happens to your friend.  He is not me, my LP is not his LP, and I don't care about him.

I'm gonna fire up that remake every single time its available.  Regardless of circumstances.  3 minutes of being afk means you basically lost the lane already, or one (if not both) of your buffs is gone if you're jungling.

Its a blatant and un-ignorable disadvantage, and if I can make it go away and move on to a game where I'm on a level playing field at absolutely no penalty to myself, I'm gonna do that.

Sorry I'm not sorry.
May be a nerd confession here, but you think legos are bad? Accidentally drop a few d4 dice on the floor in the dark. The pointy side is always up. ALWAYS. Might as well be a set of caltrops.

I vote no on remakes :P... 

Need to learn how to play from behind in bronze/silver. Some teams ff at 15 cuz their adc has 4 deaths, and yeah it's bad... but they can still win it :P

A bronze or silver player should remake at every opportunity, it gives them more chances at success. Anyone in that Elo who Votes no on a remake is at best Overconfident, and at worst Pretentious. There is no downside to a remake for either side, it actually Inefficient to take the risk, and lack of efficiency is part of what keeps bronze players in the world where they are.

Did you read my post? 

NEED to learn to play from behind... If you remake at every opportunity then you're never gonna get anywhere bc you ditch at the first signs of falling behind. 

Lack of efficiency? Bronze players are inefficient, that's why they're bronze. 

But it seems to me that taking a chance at +22LP is worth the risk when you have nothing to lose except the LP you are giving up by quitting. The only risk is time, and to be honest, if you're playing video games you probably have enough. 

The only situation I see ffing as reasonable is if someone needs to leave and the other players want to be polite.

I think you're mistaking "remake" for "surrender."

This post is about remakes, as in a player is disconnected when the game starts and you remake the game at 3 minutes.
